Questions.Question: Is sample analyzed immediately after collection within 15 minutes?
Are reagents free of contamination or growths?
Is KI solution discarded when it turns yellow?
Is pH 4 buffer solution acetate buffer?
Are reagents within their indicated shelf lives?
Is sample volume 200 ml for chlorine residual up to 2 mg/l or 100 ml or proportionately less for chlorine residuals in excess of 2 mg/l?
Is at least 1 ml KI solution added?
Is at least 1 ml acetate buffer added after KI solution?
Is titrant added in progressively smaller increments until all needle movement ceases?
Is last increment of titrant that causes no needle response subtracted from final volume?
Is the sample value calculated correctly? [TRC mg/l = A x 200 / ml of sample where A = ml PA0 used]

Comments: pre-set delivery calibrated pumps each day ensure that 1 ml is used.
